The way to verify it's a client-caused GPU memory leak would be to do the following:

from tensorflow.contrib.memory_stats.python.ops import memory_stats_ops
with tf.device("/gpu:0"):
  bytes_in_use_op = memory_stats_ops.BytesInUse()
print("memory before ", sess.run(bytes_in_use_op))
del numpy_result
print("memory after ", sess.run(bytes_in_use_op))

If memory changes, then it's a GPU leak

The way to verify it's a client-caused GPU memory leak would be to do the following:
```
from tensorflow.contrib.memory_stats.python.ops import memory_stats_ops
with tf.device("/gpu:0"):
  bytes_in_use_op = memory_stats_ops.BytesInUse()
print("memory before ", sess.run(bytes_in_use_op))
del numpy_result
print("memory after ", sess.run(bytes_in_use_op))
```

If memory changes, then it's a GPU leak
